meanings.definition: To keep someone or something away from other people or things.
meanings.sent1: The shy cat enjoys secluding itself under the bed.
meanings.sent2: During the game of hide and seek, the children love secluding themselves in the closet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried secluding the acorns in a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The old library was secluding a treasure trove of forgotten books.
meanings.sent5: The magician's cloak seemed to have the power of secluding him from the audience's view.

meanings.definition: To shut off or keep apart, as from company, society, etc.
meanings.sent1: The thick curtains secluding the room from the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The castle walls were secluding the princess from the outside world.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious character always wore a hood, secluding their face from view.
meanings.sent4: The high fence secluding the garden from the rest of the yard.
meanings.sent5: The locked gate was secluding the old mansion from curious onlookers.

meanings.definition: To remove or separate from contact with others.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended secluding the sick child to prevent spreading the flu.
meanings.sent2: The scientist secluding the rare butterfly species for further study.
meanings.sent3: The hermit secluding himself in the mountains to find inner peace.
meanings.sent4: The quarantine measures secluding the infected patients from the healthy ones.
meanings.sent5: The artist secluding themselves in the studio to focus on their latest masterpiece.
